text: was a castle structure in Kumano, Mie, Japan. ==History== Akagi Castle was built in 1589 by Tōdō Takatora. Takatora spent 11 years in the catle. ==Current== Akagi castle is now only ruins, with some stone walls and moats. The castle was listed as one of the Continued Top 100 Japanese Castles in 2017. ==See also== *List of Historic Sites of Japan (Mie) ==References== Category:Castles in Mie Prefecture Category:Historic Sites of Japan Category:Former castles in Japan Category:Ruined castles in Japan
title: Akagi Castle
